result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Heywood

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

10:13 AM Defendant Marcus D Heywood in court.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Marcus D Heywood.  ADA Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Law Enforcement, Officer A. Georgeson, duly sworn & testified, direct exam by the ADA DeMarco; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; Cross exam by Attorney O'Connell. Redirect by ADA DeMarco. State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM Defendant Marcus D Heywood in court.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Marcus D Heywood.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Orconcha H or any residence of Orconcha H. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

02:52 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
